metadata.title: CVE-2019-6798 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in phpMyAdmin before 4.8.5. A vulnerability wasreported where a specially crafted username can be used to trigger a SQLinjection attack through the designer feature.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-6798` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

phpmyadmin - 4:4.9.2+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:4.9.2+dfsg1-1').
